revised_title: Exploring the Regulation of HMG-CoA Reductase through Mevalonate-derived Sterols
tldr: Researchers investigated the effects of three inhibitors on 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl coenzyme A (HMG-CoA) reductase in cultured rat hepatoma cells. They found that mevalonate, a sterol, suppresses the reductase's activity, suggesting that it may act as a repressor derived from mevalonate metabolism. This discovery provides insights into the regulation of cholesterol synthesis in cells.
